SailPoint is the Worldwide Leader for Enterprise-Class IAM (Identity and Access Management). We minimize risk and maximize business growth by managing access to data and resources across our client’s enterprise. We do it effectively and securely for every person who interacts with our client’s organization—any user, on any device, anywhere in the world.
We were first to recognize that companies could benefit from an approach to identity that addresses both IT and business priorities. BA/BS degree in computer science or relevant degree or work experience

Excellent communication skills in written and oral English
Familiarity with Scrum and Agile methodologies.

Job Description

In this role your work will focus on modelling sophisticated business problems and developing / deploying the algorithmic features of technology products at scale.

As an Associate Data Scientist; you are responsible for:
Completing small Data Science tasks under the guidance of more experienced members of the team.
Quickly learning about hypothesis-driven product development.
Quickly learning about software development best practices.
Quickly learning about the team's tech stack.
Quickly learning agile project management.

The Data Science Team's work spans across multiple business domains including physical stores; online; supply chain; marketing and Clubcard and we encourage rotation so our Data Scientists can gain expertise in different business and technical domains.

As a member of the Data Science Team; you will have the opportunity to work on problem spaces including but not limited to Search & Recommendations; Personalisation; Pricing Optimisation; Operations Optimisation in Fulfilment and Distribution; Forecasting and Computer Vision. We also dedicate Friday afternoons to self-learning and personal development.

This is a hands-on position where you will need to demonstrate your analytical approach to finding solutions to sophisticated problems. You will need to understand difficult business problems and prototype solutions with minimal support. Apply; modify and design algorithms and mathematical models to tackle business problems on top of big data architectures (Hadoop; Spark) is a core component of the role.

Our Associate Data Scientists need to be able to validate; document and present the modelling process and performances; as well as communicate sophisticated solutions in a clear; understandable way to non-experts.

Associate Data Scientists are also responsible for promoting data science across Tesco and promote Tesco across the external Data Science community.

Qualifications

Machine Learning; Statistics; AI

RamSoft is a global leader in Web based Radiology Solutions. Experience creating efficient data pipeline

Thriving in a fast-paced, quickly evolving, tech start-up environment
Contributing to a collaborative, dynamic, and diverse team


You will REALLY stand out if you also have following:

Deployed ML models in production

ABOUT THE ROLE
Dyson Global IT are seeking a Data Scientist who will be responsible for creating and maintaining data models and algorithms to support the project. They will work closely with the project team and external stakeholders to ensure that the project can leverage data effectively to meet ambitious objectives.
The Data Scientist will be responsible for extracting and transforming data from multiple sources, and leveraging it to build predictive and prescriptive models. They will also be involved in developing and validating machine learning models, and will closely work with users from the business to ensure that the models are tailored to their needs, and can be used to gain insights, automate processes and improve decision making.
Solid experience in data science and machine learning is essential for this role. Strong analytical and problem-solving skills are also essential, as project requirements may evolve over time and the Data Scientist will need to be able to adapt the data models and algorithms accordingly.
Responsibilities
Excellent business acumen - you are someone who can quickly absorb a new domain, and recognise what problems are most valuable for our stakeholders.
A scientific and rigorous approach to solving practical problems using logical thinking.
Extract and transform data from multiple sources to create a unified data set.
Leverage data to build predictive and prescriptive models.
Develop and validate machine learning models to solve complex problems.
Collaborate with other teams to ensure that data models and algorithms are integrated with the project’s overall architecture.
Analyse performance metrics to identify areas for improvement.
Ensure that all data is securely stored and backed up.
Identify and implement new technologies and tools to improve the data infrastructure.
Monitor, troubleshoot and resolve data infrastructure issues in a timely manner.
Requirements
Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Mathematics, Statistics, or related field.
2+ years of experience in data science and machine learning. Familiarity with machine learning frameworks such as TensorFlow, PyTorch or Keras.
Proficiency in one or more programming languages such as Python or R and knowledge in common data structures and algorithms.
Proficiency in SQL languages such as MySQL or PostgreSQL.
Hands-on experience with data analysis, data cleaning, wrangling and prescriptive analytics.
Experience applying machine learning methods like clustering, tree-based models, neural networks and time series models. Experience in XGBoost and LightGBM is a plus.
Fluent in Git and familiar with CI/CD/CT practices to develop and deliver software optimally.
Knowledge of how to build enterprise data science products in cloud environments such as GCP is a bonus. Comfortable querying modern cloud databases (e.g., BigQuery, Snowflake, Redshift).
Excellent communication skills and ability to work independently and as part of a team.
Passion for learning new technologies and techniques.
Familiarity with data visualization tools such as matplotlib, Tableau, Looker is an added advantage.
Has a passion to understand Dyson, to frame its problems, and to deliver tactical solutions in short timeframes when required.
Dyson is an equal opportunity employer. We know that great minds don’t think alike, and it takes all kinds of minds to make our technology so unique. We welcome applications from all backgrounds and employment decisions are made without regard to race, colour, religion, national or ethnic origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, disability, protected veteran status or other any other dimension of diversity.

Job Title: Data Scientist
Location: Noida
About Barclays
Barclays is a British universal bank. We are diversified by business, by different types of customers and clients, and by geography. Our businesses include consumer banking and payments operations around the world, as well as a top-tier, full service, global corporate and investment bank, all of which are supported by our service company which provides technology, operations and functional services across the Group.
Risk and Control Objective
Ensure that all activities and duties are carried out in full compliance with regulatory requirements, Enterprise Wide Risk Management Framework and internal Barclays Policies and Policy Standards.

Working Flexibly
We’re committed to providing a supportive and inclusive culture and environment for you to work in. This environment recognises and supports ways to balance your personal needs, alongside the professional needs of our business. Providing the opportunity for all our employees, globally to work flexibly empowers each of us to work in a way that suits our lives as well as enabling us to better service our customers’ and clients’ needs. Whether you have family commitments or you’re a carer, or whether you need study time or wish to pursue personal interests, our approach to working flexibly is designed to help you balance your life. If you would like some flexibility, then please discuss this with the hiring manager, and your request will be reviewed subject to business needs.
Hybrid Working

We are currently in the early stages of implementing a hybrid working environment, which means that many colleagues spend part of their working hours at home and part in the office, depending on the nature of the role they are in. We’re flexible on how this works and it may continue to change and evolve. As part of the Data Science team, you will be part of the effort to transform Jai Kisan into an AI driven fintech company. We are looking for someone who has a proven track record of solving a variety of data science problems ( minimum 1 year of relevant work experience and a project portfolio on Github).
As a member of the data science team, you will be involved in strategizing new projects that add value to the business and implement them end-to-end. These projects will involve analyzing data, making statistical inferences to gain deep insights and building predictive modelsto generate significant business value and aid more informed decision making.
Day to day tasks will involve:
Identifying valuable data sources and automate collection processes
Undertaking pre-processing of structured and unstructured data
Analyzing large amounts of information to discover trends and patterns
Building predictive models and machine-learning algorithms
Presenting information using data visualization techniques
Proposing solutions and strategies to business challenges
Collaborating with other teams in the organization

Algorithm Development: Machine learning, Deep learning, and advanced Algorithmic solution development

Familiarity with tech stacks and ability to building scalable and production ready models

Jaikisan at a glance
Team of >500 people
Located in Bangalore, Karnataka, India
About Jaikisan
OUR VISION: Jai Kisan was founded with the vision of making financial inclusion a reality for rural individuals and businesses. Jai Kisan today provides digital financial services starting with credit for online and offline, income generating, rural commerce transactions. THE PROBLEM WE ARE SOLVING: Informal credit by the merchant or seller is an expectation for customers and not a value-added service in rural India. Lack of formalized credit poses a dire and imperative challenge for rural businesses to grow. WHAT WE DO: Jai Kisan has leveraged the captive relationship between the business and the farmer and rural individuals in a B2B2C manner to deploy credit to farmers and rural individuals en masse in a sustainable manner working with 700+ organized and unorganized entities in the space with a cumulative customer base of over 1.5 lakh rural individuals including farmers. By empowering rural businesses through point-of-sale/purchase credit, Jai-Kisan has helped create scalability for rural businesses and helps deploy low-cost formal credit to farmers and other rural individuals. OUR INVESTORS: Jai Kisan has raised US $30mn in Series A funding led by Mirae Asset with participation from Syngenta Group Ventures, existing investors and others, prior to this, Jai Kisan had raised US$ 4mn in a pre-Series A funding round led by Arkam Ventures. Also joining in the round was NABVENTURES — the VC arm of Indian development finance institution (DFI), the National Bank for Agriculture and Rural Development (NABARD) in its first-ever private investment. WHO WORKS AT JAI KISAN: The Jai Kisan team is dedicated towards executing our mission and is passionate towards supporting the transformation of rural India. An entrepreneurial attitude and passion to drive results are core values we seek in every member of our team. Our team comes with varied industry experiences from experienced product builders to industries such as private equity, management consultancy and much more. We pride ourselves on having a dedicated professional team focused on building world class solutions to deliver sustainable financing to rural India.

Job Description

In this role your work will focus on modelling sophisticated business problems and developing / deploying the algorithmic features of technology products at scale.

As an Associate Data Scientist; you are responsible for:
Completing small Data Science tasks under the guidance of more experienced members of the team.
Quickly learning about hypothesis-driven product development.
Quickly learning about software development best practices.
Quickly learning about the team's tech stack.
Quickly learning agile project management.

The Data Science Team's work spans across multiple business domains including physical stores; online; supply chain; marketing and Clubcard and we encourage rotation so our Data Scientists can gain expertise in different business and technical domains.

As a member of the Data Science Team; you will have the opportunity to work on problem spaces including but not limited to Search & Recommendations; Personalisation; Pricing Optimisation; Operations Optimisation in Fulfilment and Distribution; Forecasting and Computer Vision. We also dedicate Friday afternoons to self-learning and personal development.

This is a hands-on position where you will need to demonstrate your analytical approach to finding solutions to sophisticated problems. You will need to understand difficult business problems and prototype solutions with minimal support. Apply; modify and design algorithms and mathematical models to tackle business problems on top of big data architectures (Hadoop; Spark) is a core component of the role.

Our Associate Data Scientists need to be able to validate; document and present the modelling process and performances; as well as communicate sophisticated solutions in a clear; understandable way to non-experts.

Associate Data Scientists are also responsible for promoting data science across Tesco and promote Tesco across the external Data Science community.

Qualifications

Machine Learning; Statistics; AI

ABOUT THE ROLE
Dyson Global IT are seeking a Data Scientist who will be responsible for creating and maintaining data models and algorithms to support the project. They will work closely with the project team and external stakeholders to ensure that the project can leverage data effectively to meet ambitious objectives.
The Data Scientist will be responsible for extracting and transforming data from multiple sources, and leveraging it to build predictive and prescriptive models. They will also be involved in developing and validating machine learning models, and will closely work with users from the business to ensure that the models are tailored to their needs, and can be used to gain insights, automate processes and improve decision making.
Solid experience in data science and machine learning is essential for this role. Strong analytical and problem-solving skills are also essential, as project requirements may evolve over time and the Data Scientist will need to be able to adapt the data models and algorithms accordingly.
Responsibilities
Excellent business acumen - you are someone who can quickly absorb a new domain, and recognise what problems are most valuable for our stakeholders.
A scientific and rigorous approach to solving practical problems using logical thinking.
Extract and transform data from multiple sources to create a unified data set.
Leverage data to build predictive and prescriptive models.
Develop and validate machine learning models to solve complex problems.
Collaborate with other teams to ensure that data models and algorithms are integrated with the project’s overall architecture.
Analyse performance metrics to identify areas for improvement.
Ensure that all data is securely stored and backed up.
Identify and implement new technologies and tools to improve the data infrastructure.
Monitor, troubleshoot and resolve data infrastructure issues in a timely manner.
Requirements
Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Mathematics, Statistics, or related field.
2+ years of experience in data science and machine learning. Familiarity with machine learning frameworks such as TensorFlow, PyTorch or Keras.
Proficiency in one or more programming languages such as Python or R and knowledge in common data structures and algorithms.
Proficiency in SQL languages such as MySQL or PostgreSQL.
Hands-on experience with data analysis, data cleaning, wrangling and prescriptive analytics.
Experience applying machine learning methods like clustering, tree-based models, neural networks and time series models. Experience in XGBoost and LightGBM is a plus.
Fluent in Git and familiar with CI/CD/CT practices to develop and deliver software optimally.
Knowledge of how to build enterprise data science products in cloud environments such as GCP is a bonus. Comfortable querying modern cloud databases (e.g., BigQuery, Snowflake, Redshift).
Excellent communication skills and ability to work independently and as part of a team.
Passion for learning new technologies and techniques.
Familiarity with data visualization tools such as matplotlib, Tableau, Looker is an added advantage.
Has a passion to understand Dyson, to frame its problems, and to deliver tactical solutions in short timeframes when required.

At IBM, work is more than a job - it's a calling: To build. To design. To code. To consult. To think along with clients and sell. To make markets. To invent. To collaborate. Not just to do something better, but to attempt things you've never thought possible. Are you ready to lead in this new era of technology and solve some of the world's most challenging problems? If so, lets talk.

IBM provides you with the most comprehensive and consistent approach to development, security and operations across hybrid environments—with complete software solutions for business and IT operations, development, data science, security, and management. Our experts and software capabilities help organizations develop applications once and deploy them anywhere, integrate security across the breadth of their IT estate, and automate operations with management visibility. Overview
The ideal candidate needs to have 8+ years of experience in product management, with a track record of delivering successful SaaS products. You will be leading a team of product owners and solution engineers to onboard, implement and manage revenue from customers subscribing to our compliance-as-a-service (CaaS) platform. The responsibilities of the candidate will be as follows -
Responsibilities
Understand the revenue streams: As a Lead Product Manager, it's important to understand the different revenue streams of your product, such as subscription fees, usage fees, and transaction fees. This understanding will help you identify areas of the product that are driving revenue growth, as well as areas that may need improvement. The data helps you to make informed pricing decisions.

Monitor costs: You should also keep a close eye on costs associated with product development and delivery, such as engineering and hosting expenses, customer support costs, and marketing spend. Regularly monitoring these costs will help you identify areas where you can optimize spending to maximize profitability.

Identify opportunities for revenue growth: Analyze market trends and customer needs to identify opportunities for revenue growth. For example, consider expanding your product offerings to meet new market needs, or launching new functionalities or optimizing your sales strategy to drive greater revenue per customer.

Manage product lifecycle: Develop and execute the product vision and roadmap for our CaaS platform, working closely with cross-functional teams including engineering, design, support and account management.

Optimize customer acquisition and retention: Work closely with marketing and account management teams to optimize customer acquisition and retention strategies. Analyse customer churn rates and retention metrics to ensure that you're keeping customers engaged and satisfied, and regularly review customer acquisition costs to ensure that you're acquiring new customers efficiently.

Regularly report on financial performance: As a Lead Product Manager, you'll likely be responsible for regularly reporting on the financial performance of your product to key stakeholders, such as C-Suite. Ensure that you're regularly tracking and reporting on key financial metrics, such as revenue, growth, and use this data to inform product strategy and decision-making.

Strong analytical skills and the ability to use data to inform product decisions

As a solutions product manager, you will be the engine behind Skit's deployments. You will be responsible for the voice-assistant's end-to-end delivery execution for our enterprise customers.


Responsibilities :

Solutions product manager leads the project for the completion deployment duration starting after the sales handover. In your role, you will work cross-functionally with our Engineering, Product, and Delivery, Quality Assurance teams, as well as liaise with the enterprise clients.
You will be required to track and stabilise projects, estimating resource requirements, remove roadblocks when needed, and anticipate customer needs to ensure that we are constantly improving our delivery performance.
Your goal is to make deployments fly, and you mustn't be afraid to get your hands dirty when needed.
People management: Managing internal and external stakeholders, partner agencies, and project team members to ensure the timely delivery of the client projects.
Attention to detail: Maintaining accurate records and diligently tracking key metrics such as potential risks, delivery schedule, escalations, resource requirements, etc. for the health and performance of the project.
Process efficient: This position requires a combination of project management, process optimisation, and execution. You will be required to show strong prioritisation skills to utilise the resources to ensure the maximum project progress.
Frontline the project: You will be the first responders when things go wrong (you are anyway the first responder when everything is going good). We are looking for people who love fixing problems even when it is not their own.
Quality assurance: You will be working closely with product, quality assurance, and customer teams to set the right expectations of the product and maintain high levels of customer satisfaction.
Technical collaboration: You will be leading the completion of a client engagement, which will involve leading and directing technical tasks across teams.

Candidate Attributes

2+ years of experience working as a project manager for on-cloud/on-premise software projects OR 1+ years of experience working as a product manager
1+ years of experience working in customer facing roles such as account management and professional services
Demonstrates a working understanding of both quality assurance and software development processes/methodologies
Relevant project management certification (PMP, CSM, CAPM, or equivalent) holder
Strong analytical skills, able to analyse/evaluate trends and compile reports
Exceptional judgment and composure in high-pressure situations
Passionate for developing a relationship with the clients
Outstanding ability to clearly and tactfully articulate problems and resolutions
Excellent customer service skills
Ability to travel up to 20% of the time
Excellent oral and presentation communication skills
Proven track record of working in a fast-paced and highly collaborative environment

Introduction
At IBM, work is more than a job - it's a calling: To build. To design. To code. To consult. To think along with clients and sell. To make markets. To invent. To collaborate. Not just to do something better, but to attempt things you've never thought possible. Are you ready to lead in this new era of technology and solve some of the world's most challenging problems? If so, lets talk.

Your Role and Responsibilities
We are seeking a Product-Led Growth Product Manager who will be responsible for leading the growth strategy of our Integration SaaS products through the use of data-driven insights and customer behavior analysis. The ideal candidate will have an understanding of Segment and Amplitude tools and be able to leverage these tools to make informed decisions about our product roadmap and user experience. As a Product Manager, you will collaborate with cross-functional teams to identify and prioritize growth opportunities, and execute on initiatives to improve customer acquisition, engagement, and retention.

Key Responsibilities:
Analyze customer behavior data using Segment and Amplitude to develop insights that inform product strategy.
Develop and maintain scorecards and reports to track key metrics related to product-led growth, such as user acquisition, activation, retention, and monetization.
Develop and execute on initiatives to improve customer acquisition, engagement, and retention.
Monitor key metrics and KPIs to track product performance and make data-driven decisions.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including product managers, designers, engineers, marketers, and sales to ensure the product meets customer needs and delivers a seamless user experience.
Engage with user research teams to conduct usability testing to validate assumptions and uncover new opportunities.
Stay up-to-date on industry trends and best practices related to product-led growth and customer behavior analysis.

Required Technical and Professional Expertise

8+ years of experience in product management preferably in a product-led growth or SaaS environment.
Deep understanding of Segment and Amplitude tools or ability to gain skills quickly
Proven track record of delivering successful growth initiatives in a product-led organization
Strong analytical and data-driven decision-making skills
Excellent communication skills and ability to collaborate effectively with cross-functional teams.
Strong attention to detail and ability to work independently in a fast-paced environment.

Preferred Technical and Professional Expertise

Bachelor's degree in Business Administration, Computer Science, Marketing or related field
1+ years of experience in product management preferably in a product-led growth or SaaS environment.
Some understanding of Segment and Amplitude tools or ability to gain skills quickly
Strong analytical and data-driven decision-making skills
Good communication skills and ability to collaborate effectively with cross-functional teams.

Our experts and software capabilities help organizations develop applications once and deploy them anywhere, integrate security across the breadth of their IT estate, and automate operations with management visibility.
